head.title: Spotlight Magazine Bought by Martinelli Family

hedline.hl1: Spotlight Magazine Bought by Martinelli Family

abstract.p: Spotlight magazine will shift focus from New York metropolitan area to Westchester County in wake of purchase by Martinelli family from founder, Susan Meadow Engel; photo (S)

block.p: Spotlight magazine, which has a circulation of 64,000, will shift its focus from the broader metropolitan region to Westchester County and vicinity under new owners, the Martinelli family, who bought it last month from its founder, Susan Meadow Engel, for an undisclosed price.

Ralph and Thomas Martinelli, who publish Hudson Valley magazine, and their brother Robert, publisher of several Delaware magazines, are planning a January relaunch of the 23-year-old monthly, which covers life styles and entertainment. The new owners retained the magazine's staff.

The brothers' father, Angelo, a former mayor of Yonkers, will be chairman of the Spotlight magazine company.
